TI: Memory hierarchies map onto the hippocampal long axis in humans.
AB: Memories, similar to the internal representation of space, can be recalled at different resolutions ranging from detailed events to more comprehensive, multi-event narratives. Single-cell recordings in rodents have suggested that different spatial scales are represented as a gradient along the hippocampal axis. We found that a similar organization holds for human episodic memory: memory representations systematically vary in scale along the hippocampal long axis, which may enable the formation of mnemonic hierarchies.
AD: Radboud University, Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behaviour, Nijmegen, the Netherlands.
